verses.verse: Why, <S%H199><s%> Job, <S%H347><s%> I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, hear <S%H8085><s%> my speeches, <S%H4405><s%> and listen <S%H238><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> my words. <S%H1697><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> I have opened <S%H6605><s%> my mouth, <S%H6310><s%> my tongue <S%H3956><s%> has spoken <S%H1696><s%> in my mouth. <S%H2441><s%>
My words <S%H561><s%> shall be of the uprightness <S%H3476><s%> of my heart: <S%H3820><s%> and my lips <S%H8193><s%> shall utter <S%H4448><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%> clearly. <S%H1305><s%>
The spirit <S%H7307><s%> of God <S%H410><s%> has made <S%H6213><s%> me, and the breath <S%H5397><s%> of the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> has given me life. <S%H2421><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> you can <S%H3201><s%> answer <S%H7725><s%> me, set your words in order <S%H6186><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me, stand <S%H3320><s%> up.
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I am according to your wish <S%H6310><s%> in God's <S%H410><s%> stead: I also <S%H1571><s%> am formed <S%H7169><s%> out of the clay. <S%H2563><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> my terror <S%H367><s%> shall not make you afraid, <S%H1204><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall my hand <S%H405><s%> be heavy <S%H3513><s%> on you.
Surely <S%H389><s%> you have spoken <S%H559><s%> in my hearing, <S%H241><s%> and I have heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of your words, <S%H4405><s%> saying,
I am clean <S%H2134><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> transgression, <S%H6588><s%> I am innocent; <S%H2643><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> is there iniquity <S%H5771><s%> in me.
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> he finds <S%H4672><s%> occasions <S%H8569><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me, he counts <S%H2803><s%> me for his enemy, <S%H341><s%>
He puts <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> in the stocks, <S%H5465><s%> he marks <S%H8104><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my paths. <S%H734><s%>
Behold, <S%H2005><s%> in this <S%H2063><s%> you are not just: <S%H6663><s%> I will answer <S%H6030><s%> you, that God <S%H433><s%> is greater <S%H7235><s%> than man. <S%H582><s%>
Why <S%H4069><s%> do you strive <S%H7378><s%> against <S%H413><s%> him? for he gives not account <S%H6030><s%> of any <S%H3605><s%> of his matters. <S%H1697><s%>
For God <S%H410><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> once, <S%H259><s%> yes twice, <S%H8147><s%> yet man perceives <S%H7789><s%> it not.

In a dream, <S%H2472><s%> in a vision <S%H2384><s%> of the night, <S%H3915><s%> when deep <S%H8639><s%> sleep falls <S%H5307><s%> on men, <S%H582><s%> in slumberings <S%H8572><s%> on the bed; <S%H4904><s%>
Then <S%H227><s%> he opens <S%H1540><s%> the ears <S%H241><s%> of men, <S%H582><s%> and seals <S%H2856><s%> their instruction, <S%H4561><s%>
That he may withdraw <S%H5493><s%> man <S%H120><s%> from his purpose, <S%H4639><s%> and hide <S%H3680><s%> pride <S%H1466><s%> from man. <S%H1397><s%>
He keeps <S%H2820><s%> back <S%H2820><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from the pit, <S%H7845><s%> and his life <S%H2416><s%> from perishing <S%H5674><s%> by the sword. <S%H7973><s%>
He is chastened <S%H3198><s%> also with pain <S%H4341><s%> on his bed, <S%H4904><s%> and the multitude <S%H7379><s%> of his bones <S%H6106><s%> with strong <S%H386><s%> pain:
So that his life <S%H2416><s%> abhors <S%H2092><s%> bread, <S%H3899><s%> and his soul <S%H5315><s%> dainty <S%H8378><s%> meat. <S%H3978><s%>
His flesh <S%H1320><s%> is consumed <S%H3615><s%> away, that it cannot <S%H3808><s%> be seen; <S%H7210><s%> and his bones <S%H6106><s%> that were not seen <S%H7200><s%> stick <S%H8205><s%> out.
Yes, his soul <S%H5315><s%> draws near <S%H7126><s%> to the grave, <S%H7845><s%> and his life <S%H2416><s%> to the destroyers. <S%H4191><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> there be a messenger <S%H4397><s%> with him, an interpreter, <S%H3887><s%> one <S%H259><s%> among <S%H4480><s%> a thousand, <S%H505><s%> to show <S%H5046><s%> to man <S%H120><s%> his uprightness: <S%H3476><s%>

Then he is gracious <S%H2603><s%> to him, and said, <S%H559><s%> Deliver <S%H6308><s%> him from going <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit: <S%H7845><s%> I have found <S%H4672><s%> a ransom. <S%H3724><s%>
His flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall be fresher <S%H7375><s%> than a child's: <S%H5290><s%> he shall return <S%H7725><s%> to the days <S%H3117><s%> of his youth: <S%H5934><s%>

He shall pray <S%H6279><s%> to God, <S%H433><s%> and he will be favorable <S%H7521><s%> to him: and he shall see <S%H7200><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> with joy: <S%H8643><s%> for he will render <S%H7725><s%> to man <S%H582><s%> his righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

He looks <S%H7789><s%> on men, <S%H582><s%> and if any say, <S%H559><s%> I have sinned, <S%H2398><s%> and perverted <S%H5753><s%> that which was right, <S%H3477><s%> and it profited <S%H7737><s%> me not;
He will deliver <S%H6299><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from going <S%H5674><s%> into the pit, <S%H7845><s%> and his life <S%H2416><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> the light. <S%H216><s%>
See, <S%H2005><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> these <S%H428><s%> things works <S%H6466><s%> God <S%H410><s%> oftentimes <S%H6471><s%> <S%H7969><s%> with man, <S%H1397><s%>
To bring <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from the pit, <S%H7845><s%> to be enlightened <S%H215><s%> with the light <S%H216><s%> of the living. <S%H2416><s%>
Mark <S%H7181><s%> well, <S%H7181><s%> O Job, <S%H347><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me: hold <S%H2790><s%> your peace, <S%H2790><s%> and I will speak. <S%H1696><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> you have <S%H3426><s%> anything <S%H3605><s%> to say, <S%H4405><s%> answer <S%H7725><s%> me: speak, <S%H1696><s%> for I desire <S%H2654><s%> to justify <S%H6663><s%> you.
If <S%H518><s%> not, listen <S%H8085><s%> to me: hold <S%H2790><s%> your peace, <S%H2790><s%> and I shall teach <S%H502><s%> you wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
